name: THALITA KOUM!!!
description: I produced this art in October 2020, almost a year after losing my mother. It talks about strength, faith, calm and persistence. The kite comes as a representation of the life that got injured and needed to rest from flying to make bandages, the bandages come as a representation of the faith and the "brutal calm" necessary to fly again. "Thalita Koum!" is also a phrase spoken by Jesus in Aramaic which means something close to: "Young man, get up"
